alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 8:28AM EST until January 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Passaic, Essex, and Morris Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, street flooding begins in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM Friday the river level was 18.92 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon, reaching a crest of 19.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It should then fall below flood stage late on Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 18.92 Fri 815 am 19.0 18.5 19.1 1am 1/28 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening by 830 PM EST.
